page.title: 03PIT CLOSURE AT WORSBROUGH
page.content: The men who were interviewed were sorry the pit had to close. Most of them had worked there a long time. Everyone at{Barrow}had got on well together. It had been a friendly place. Now some have been given jobs at{Barnsley Main Colliery},but they do not like having to travel further to work. They are pleased to still have a job though. Others have had to take early retirement as they did not need as many men at Barnsley Main. In a couple of months nobody will be left at Barrow, it will have closed altogether to be turned into a golf course. The miners thought that this will be as good a use as any for the land and it will bring a lot of pleasure to the people of Birdwell and Worsbrough.
